explanationSteps.text: Probability measures how likely something is to happen, expressed as a number between 0 and 1. Zero means impossible, one means certain, and values in between show varying degrees of likelihood.
explanationSteps.title: What Is Probability?

explanationSteps.text: The sample space is the set of all possible outcomes. For a coin flip, it's heads or tails. For a die roll, it's 1 through 6. Knowing the sample space is the first step in calculating probabilities.
explanationSteps.title: Sample Space

explanationSteps.text: To find the probability of an event, divide favorable outcomes by total possible outcomes. If 2 out of 6 die faces are even, the probability of rolling an even number is 2/6 or about 33%.
explanationSteps.title: Calculating Probability

userInput.lessonDescription: Understanding how probability thinking helps us make better decisions in uncertain situations

explanationSteps.text: Supply represents how much producers are willing to sell at different prices. Higher prices encourage more production because potential profits increase.
explanationSteps.title: The Supply Side

explanationSteps.text: Demand represents how much consumers want to buy at different prices. Lower prices attract more buyers because products become more affordable.
explanationSteps.title: The Demand Side

explanationSteps.text: Market equilibrium occurs where supply and demand curves intersect. At this price, sellers sell exactly what buyers want to buy — no shortages, no surpluses.
explanationSteps.title: Finding Equilibrium

userInput.lessonDescription: Recognizing how supply and demand forces shape prices and availability in markets all around us

explanationSteps.text: Recursion is when something is defined in terms of itself. A function calling itself, a definition referencing itself, or a structure containing smaller versions of itself.
explanationSteps.title: Self-Reference

explanationSteps.text: Every recursion needs a base case — the simplest version that doesn't recurse further. Without it, the recursion would continue forever.
explanationSteps.title: The Base Case

explanationSteps.text: Recursive solutions break big problems into smaller identical problems. Solve the small ones, combine the results, and the big problem solves itself.
explanationSteps.title: Divide and Conquer

userInput.lessonDescription: Discovering recursive patterns in programming, nature, art, and everyday problem-solving

explanationSteps.text: Vieses cognitivos sao erros sistematicos no pensamento que afetam nossas decisoes. Nao sao estupidez — sao atalhos mentais que funcionam na maioria das vezes, mas falham em certas situacoes.
explanationSteps.title: O Que Sao Vieses

explanationSteps.text: Heuristicas sao regras praticas que nosso cerebro usa para decidir rapidamente. Elas economizam energia mental, mas podem nos levar a conclusoes erradas quando aplicadas no contexto errado.
explanationSteps.title: Atalhos Mentais

explanationSteps.text: O vies de confirmacao nos faz buscar informacoes que confirmam o que ja acreditamos. Ignoramos evidencias contrarias e supervalorizamos as que apoiam nossa visao.
explanationSteps.title: Vies de Confirmacao

userInput.lessonDescription: Reconhecendo como vieses cognitivos afetam nossas decisoes em compras, relacionamentos, politica e vida cotidiana

steps.conclusion: None. The chosen examples are scientifically accurate, highly relevant real-world applications of natural selection, and perfectly match the requested scope and domains.

There is a minor issue with teleological language in Steps 4 and 6. The prompt explicitly warned to penalize if 'Examples suggest intentional evolution or "design" (natural selection is blind)'. Phrases like 'han evolucionado para dejar caer semillas' (Step 4) and 'evolucionando para ser diminutas... para no ser pescadas' (Step 6) suggest that the organisms evolved with a specific purpose or goal, which contradicts the blind nature of natural selection.

Rephrase Steps 4 and 6 to remove intentional/teleological language. Instead of saying species evolved *to* avoid being fished or *to* drop heavier seeds, explain that individuals that naturally possessed smaller sizes or heavier seeds were the ones that survived and reproduced, making those traits dominant over time.

explanationSteps.text: La seleccion natural ocurre cuando individuos con ciertos rasgos sobreviven y se reproducen mas que otros. Estos rasgos se vuelven mas comunes en generaciones futuras.
explanationSteps.title: Supervivencia Diferencial

explanationSteps.text: La variacion es esencial — sin diferencias entre individuos, no hay nada que seleccionar. Las mutaciones y la reproduccion sexual generan esta variacion.
explanationSteps.title: Variacion Genetica

explanationSteps.text: La aptitud biologica mide el exito reproductivo, no la fuerza fisica. Un organismo 'apto' es el que deja mas descendientes viables, no necesariamente el mas fuerte.
explanationSteps.title: Aptitud Biologica

userInput.lessonDescription: Observando como la seleccion natural moldea la vida a nuestro alrededor, desde bacterias hasta mascotas

explanationSteps.text: Machine learning is when computers learn from examples rather than following explicit rules. Show a system thousands of cat photos, and it learns to recognize cats without being told what a cat looks like.
explanationSteps.title: Learning from Data

explanationSteps.text: Training data is the set of examples the system learns from. The quality and quantity of training data largely determines how well the model performs.
explanationSteps.title: Training Data

explanationSteps.text: Models are mathematical patterns extracted from data. Once trained, they can make predictions on new data they haven't seen before — that's the real power of ML.
explanationSteps.title: Models and Predictions

userInput.lessonDescription: Discovering where machine learning already works in apps, devices, and services you use daily

explanationSteps.text: Compound interest is earning interest on your interest. Unlike simple interest that only grows the original amount, compound interest grows the total including previous interest earned.
explanationSteps.title: Interest on Interest

explanationSteps.text: The compounding period determines how often interest is calculated. Monthly compounding adds interest 12 times per year; daily compounding adds it 365 times. More frequent = faster growth.
explanationSteps.title: Compounding Frequency

explanationSteps.text: The Rule of 72 estimates doubling time: divide 72 by the interest rate. At 8% annual return, money doubles roughly every 9 years. This quick mental math reveals compounding's power.
explanationSteps.title: The Rule of 72

userInput.lessonDescription: Recognizing how compound growth shapes wealth building, debt accumulation, and many other life phenomena

explanationSteps.text: A fotossintese converte luz solar em energia quimica. Plantas capturam fotons e usam essa energia para transformar agua e CO2 em glicose — o combustivel da vida.
explanationSteps.title: Captura de Luz

explanationSteps.text: A clorofila e o pigmento que absorve luz. Ela captura principalmente luz vermelha e azul, refletindo verde — por isso as plantas tem essa cor.
explanationSteps.title: O Papel da Clorofila

explanationSteps.text: O oxigenio que respiramos e um subproduto da fotossintese. Quando plantas quebram agua para obter hidrogenio, liberam O2 como residuo.
explanationSteps.title: Origem do Oxigenio

userInput.lessonDescription: Descobrindo como a fotossintese sustenta a vida na Terra e afeta nosso ar, comida e clima
userInput.lessonTitle: Fotossintese e a Vida na Terra

explanationSteps.text: La encriptacion transforma datos legibles en codigo ilegible. Solo quien tiene la clave correcta puede revertir el proceso y leer el contenido original.
explanationSteps.title: Datos Codificados

explanationSteps.text: Las claves son como llaves digitales. La encriptacion simetrica usa una clave compartida; la asimetrica usa un par de claves — una publica y una privada.
explanationSteps.title: Claves de Encriptacion

explanationSteps.text: HTTPS en sitios web significa que la conexion esta encriptada. El candado en tu navegador indica que los datos viajan protegidos entre tu dispositivo y el servidor.
explanationSteps.title: HTTPS y Conexiones Seguras

userInput.lessonDescription: Descubriendo donde la encriptacion protege silenciosamente tu informacion en aplicaciones, sitios y dispositivos cotidianos

2. CONTEXT CHECK: Penalize if examples are limited to engineering/biology. Feedback loops appear in social media, economics, relationships, climate, habits, and organizational behavior.

3. DISTINCTION FROM EXPLANATION: The explanation covered WHAT feedback loops are (outputs affecting inputs). This should show WHERE feedback dynamics shape systems and behaviors around us.

explanationSteps.text: A feedback loop occurs when a system's output circles back to influence its input. The result of an action affects the conditions that produced it, creating a cycle.
explanationSteps.title: Circular Causation

explanationSteps.text: Negative feedback stabilizes systems by counteracting change. When temperature rises, a thermostat activates cooling. The response opposes the initial change.
explanationSteps.title: Negative Feedback

explanationSteps.text: Positive feedback amplifies change. A microphone near a speaker creates a growing screech — sound feeds back and gets louder. Positive feedback often leads to rapid escalation.
explanationSteps.title: Positive Feedback

userInput.lessonDescription: Recognizing feedback loops in technology, nature, society, and personal habits that amplify or stabilize outcomes

2. CONTEXT CHECK: Penalize if examples are limited to money. Opportunity cost applies to time, attention, energy, relationships, career paths, and any scarce resource allocation.

explanationSteps.text: Opportunity cost is what you give up when you choose one option over another. It's not just about money — it's about the value of your next best alternative.
explanationSteps.title: The Trade-Off

explanationSteps.text: Every choice has an opportunity cost because resources are scarce. Choosing to spend an hour on Netflix means not spending it on exercise, reading, or side projects.
explanationSteps.title: Scarcity Forces Choices

explanationSteps.text: Explicit costs are obvious — the price you pay. Implicit costs are hidden — the opportunities you forgo. True cost includes both.
explanationSteps.title: Explicit vs Implicit

userInput.lessonDescription: Seeing how opportunity cost thinking reveals the hidden trade-offs in everyday decisions about time, money, and attention
userInput.lessonTitle: The Hidden Cost of Every Choice

explanationSteps.text: A dopamina e um neurotransmissor envolvido em recompensa e motivacao. Ela nao apenas sinaliza prazer — ela antecipa recompensas e nos motiva a busca-las.
explanationSteps.title: O Papel da Dopamina

explanationSteps.text: O sistema de recompensa do cerebro usa dopamina para reforcar comportamentos. Quando algo e melhor do que esperado, ha um pico de dopamina que fortalece a conexao.
explanationSteps.title: Aprendizado por Recompensa

explanationSteps.text: A tolerancia ocorre quando o cerebro se adapta a estimulos frequentes. O mesmo estimulo produz menos dopamina com o tempo, exigindo mais para o mesmo efeito.
explanationSteps.title: Adaptacao e Tolerancia

userInput.lessonDescription: Descobrindo como a dopamina influencia motivacao, habitos, redes sociais e comportamentos do dia a dia
